plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its stunning clusters of pale pink to white flowers that bloom profusely in early spring, often celebrated in festivals across Japan and other temperate regions.
plants.location: Temperate East Asia, cultivated worldwide in temperate climates
plants.funFact: Cherry blossoms symbolize the fleeting nature of life in Japanese culture due to their very short blooming period.

plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A perennial wildflower with bright yellow trumpet-shaped flowers, often found in meadows and woodlands, signaling the arrival of spring in many parts of Europe and North America.
plants.location: Western Europe, introduced to North America
plants.funFact: The daffodil is associated with the mythical story of Narcissus, who was enchanted by his own reflection.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree or shrub that produces cylindrical spikes of golden yellow flowers, serving as an important nectar source for birds and insects in coastal regions.
plants.funFact: Banksias have woody seed cones that only release seeds after exposure to fire or extreme heat, an adaptation to Australian bushfires.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia tree admired for its large, tulip-shaped flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, blooming spectacularly in early spring before leaf emergence.
plants.location: Cultivated in temperate zones worldwide, originally from China
plants.funFact: Saucer magnolias are among the earliest flowering magnolias and their large flowers attract early pollinators like bees.
